_header: Rest and refuge to folk disconsolate
_description: John Lydgate, a prayer to St. Leonard — five 8-line (ababbcbc) and one 6-line (aabbcc) stanzas with a ‘distresse’ refrain

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
Reste and reffuge to folk dysconsolatffader off pyte and
                    consolacyoun…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…ther to be ffed with selestyal mannaWher as angelis ar wont
                    to synge osanna
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title: HEre begynneth a praier to seynt Lethenard (f. 21)
BodLauMis683.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 135-6.

CamJes56.First Lines:
[R]Est and refuge to folke disconsolateffather of pitee and
                    consolacion…
CamJes56.Last Lines:
…Þere to be feede with celestiall In annaWhere Aungels
                    were wont to syng Osanna

CamSidney37.First Lines:
BEst and refugie to folke disconsolateffadir of pyte and
                    consolacion…
CamSidney37.Last Lines:
…There to be fedde with celestialle mannaWhere angelys ar
                    wonte to syng osanna

BLHar2255.First Lines:
BEste and Refuge to folk disconsolatffadir of pite and
                    consolacioun…
BLHar2255.Last Lines:
…Ther to be fed with celestial mannaWher Angelis ar wont to
                    syngen Osanna Explicit

Halliwell-Phillipps,  James Orchard,
                        ed.
